llm.feedback:
Up | 0–12 months | Regime A easing with inflation converging to target and real rates compressing, anchored by a declining tightening urgency and productivity-driven earnings tilt toward AI beneficiaries | Jackson Hole communications signaling less tightening bias and payroll/inflation deceleration to confirm the regime shift and quantify the discount-rate path | Probability 50% (37UZC9X8I)(NL5YYTLF2)(T1QE6JPIX)(SGB2PAZGK)
Up | 3–6 months | Policy rate cuts beginning under a base-case path that would compress discount rates and support capex-friendly dynamics, with ACMR as a focused beta to macro easing and WFE/AI-infra cycles given Q2 momentum, the N2 bubbling upgrade, and continued mid-to-high single-digit revenue cadence into 2025–2026 | Fed signaling for a 50bp cut in September and a 150–175bp total cut path by year-end, and ACMR’s quarterly updates for progress on N2 bubbling and the 2025 cadence to validate near-term multiple re-rating toward the consensus target | Probability 60% (C22MKA9VY)(SK994CBWR)(22PL3Q360)
Down | 0–3 weeks | Tariff/policy shocks lifting input costs and inflation risk, as the 90-day US–China tariff pause outcome unfolds, EU auto tariffs are negotiated, and international supply chains adjust | Durability of the pause, extensions or escalations, and the practical scope of autos carve-outs that feed pricing and inventory dynamics into macro earnings streams | Probability 25% (S15934PBQ)(RHFWI02JT)
Down | 0–12 months | Regime B: persistent inflation pressures and higher-for-longer real rates driven by stronger inflation prints and resilient wage growth, reinforced by hawkish Jackson Hole communications and a slower-than-expected deceleration in payrolls | Explicit data surprises or communications pivots that alter rate expectations, tilt probabilities toward Regime B or C, and reprice risk premia across credit and equities | Probability 30% (37UZC9X8I)(NL5YYTLF2)(T1QE6JPIX)(SGB2PAZGK)
